body_html:
@mrry current solution is to

  • Accept lists of Tensors
  • Make sure that all Tensors in boundaries have the same dtype as x (with test)
  • Make sure that all Tensors in values have the same dtype (with test)

I haven't made sure that boundaries's entries are strictly increasing. Not sure of the canonical way to do this since boundaries is a Tensor.

@mrry current solution is to

Accept lists of Tensors
Make sure that all Tensors in boundaries have the same dtype as x (with test)
Make sure that all Tensors in values have the same dtype (with test)

I haven't made sure that boundaries's entries are strictly increasing. Not sure of the canonical way to do this since boundaries is a Tensor.
body:
@mrry current solution is to
- Accept lists of `Tensor`s
- Make sure that all `Tensor`s in `boundaries` have the same `dtype` as `x` (with test)
- Make sure that all `Tensor`s in `values` have the same `dtype` (with test)

I haven't made sure that `boundaries`'s entries are strictly increasing. Not sure of the canonical way to do this since `boundaries` is a `Tensor`.
